title.value: The default network dominates neural responses to evolving movie stories
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: The default network dominates neural responses to evolving movie stories

extractions.description: This paper investigates the neural responses to dynamic narratives in movies using natural language processing and hidden Markov models. By analyzing over 50,000 brain images of participants watching the movie Forrest Gump, the study identifies distinct brain states related to the semantic aspects of the narrative. It particularly emphasizes the role of the default network in semantic information integration.

type.justification: The study analyzes over 50,000 brain images and employs empirical data-driven methods rooted in natural language processing and hidden Markov models to understand neural responses.
type.quote: In our research, we utilize machine learning tools for natural language processing to examine the relationship between movie narratives and neural responses. By analyzing over 50,000 brain images of participants watching Forrest Gump from the studyforrest dataset, we find distinct brain states that capture unique semantic aspects of the unfolding story.

name.justification: The research uses natural language processing (NLP) techniques to analyze the semantic aspects of the movie narratives and their relationship to neural responses.
name.quote: NLP has become an increasingly valuable tool for studying the human language systems implemented in the human brain. Several studies have used advanced NLP techniques to build association maps between language features and brain activity.

name.justification: The study is centered around understanding how the brain responds to narrative stimuli and particularly looks at the neural correlates of high-level semantic processing.
name.quote: By analyzing over 50,000 brain images of participants watching Forrest Gump from the studyforrest dataset, we find distinct brain states that capture unique semantic aspects of the unfolding story.

name.justification: The study involves the analysis of over 50,000 brain images to determine neural states and responses.
name.quote: By analyzing over 50,000 brain images of participants watching Forrest Gump from the studyforrest dataset...

name.justification: The research leverages machine learning models, specifically hidden Markov models, to dissect brain responses to movie narratives.
name.quote: Many of today’s experimental paradigms used for studying higher-order information processing tend to hinge on vague definitions. NLP here now offers the potential of disclosing complex aspects of semantic structure in the movie material. Therefore, the strategy of porting tools from NLP to imaging neuroscience may allow to more cleanly disentangle semantically denotable higher-order brain functions in humans against the brain’s housekeeping signals and background noise.

name.justification: Hidden Markov Models are explicitly mentioned as the main analytical framework utilized to analyze dynamic functional connectivity in the brain during movie watching.
name.quote: To foreshadow our key contributions, we have developed an analytical framework enabling hidden Markov models (HMMs) at the single-subject level to analyze the dynamic functional connectivity in the brain during naturalistic movie watching.

is_contributed.justification: The paper presents the application of Hidden Markov Models as its key methodological contribution to analyze neural data in relation to narrative stimuli.
is_contributed.quote: To foreshadow our key contributions, we have developed an analytical framework enabling hidden Markov models (HMMs) at the single-subject level to analyze the dynamic functional connectivity in the brain during naturalistic movie watching.

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention of executing Hidden Markov Models on GPU or CPU in the paper.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not compare Hidden Markov Models with other models numerically.

referenced_paper_title.value: A tutorial on hidden Markov models and selected applications in speech recognition
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper uses Hidden Markov Models as part of its methodological framework and this referenced paper provides foundational understanding of HMMs.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Rabiner, L. R. (1989). A tutorial on hidden Markov models and selected applications in speech recognition. Proceedings of the IEEE, 77(2), 257-286.

name.justification: The study makes extensive use of the studyforrest dataset which consists of brain images of participants watching the movie Forrest Gump.
name.quote: By analyzing over 50,000 brain images of participants watching Forrest Gump from the studyforrest dataset, we find distinct brain states that capture unique semantic aspects of the unfolding story.

referenced_paper_title.value: A high-resolution 7-Tesla fMRI dataset from complex natural stimulation with an audio movie
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset used in the study is well-documented in this referenced paper, which details the nature of the studyforrest data collection.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Hanke, M., et al. (2014). A high-resolution 7-Tesla fMRI dataset from complex natural stimulation with an audio movie. Scientific Data, 1, 140003.

name.justification: The paper mentions using this library for preprocessing brain imaging data, such as image segmentation and extraction.
name.quote: All these data slicing and dicing steps were realized using functions from the nilearn package (https://nilearn.github.io/stable/index.html).

referenced_paper_title.value: Nilearn: Machine learning for neuroimaging in Python
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references nilearn’s usage in processing brain imaging data analytic pipelines.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Abraham, A., et al. (2014). Machine learning for neuroimaging with scikit-learn. Frontiers in Neuroinformatics, 8, 14.
